⬛ About the game:

Portal is a 2007 puzzle-platform game developed and published by Valve. It was released in a bundle, The Orange Box, for Windows, Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3, and has been since ported to other systems, including Mac OS X, Linux, Android (via Nvidia Shield), and Nintendo Switch.

Portal consists primarily of a series of puzzles that must be solved by teleporting the player's character and simple objects using "the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device", a device that can create inter-spatial portals between two flat planes. The player-character, Chell, is challenged and taunted by an artificial intelligence named GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) to complete each puzzle in the Aperture Science Enrichment Center using the portal gun with the promise of receiving cake when all the puzzles are completed. The game's unique physics allows kinetic energy to be retained through portals, requiring creative use of portals to maneuver through the test chambers. This gameplay element is based on a similar concept from the game Narbacular Drop; many of the team members from the DigiPen Institute of Technology who worked on Narbacular Drop were hired by Valve for the creation of Portal, making it a spiritual successor to the game.

Portal was acclaimed as one of the most original games of 2007, despite criticisms for its short duration and limited story. It received praise for its originality, unique gameplay and dark story with a humorous series of dialogue. GLaDOS, voiced by Ellen McLain in the English-language version, received acclaim for her unique characterization, and the end credits song "Still Alive", written by Jonathan Coulton for the game, was praised for its original composition and humorous twist. Portal is often cited as one of the greatest video games ever made. Excluding Steam download sales, over four million copies of the game have been sold since its release, spawning official merchandise from Valve including plush Companion Cubes, as well as fan recreations of the cake and portal gun.

⬛ My opinion:

immensely quotable, silly, and bizarrely creepy and unnerving, with genius nuggets of game design wisdom scattered all across it. even though this is ostensibly a fleshed out tech demo, its one of the best games ive ever played and theres not a moment on it i would extend or shorten or anything at all. it is perfect. portal 2 could only go down from here (and i still really love portal 2).

4/5

Es una gran opción incluso si nunca has jugado algo tipo puzzle. El juego hace un excelente trabajo guiándote desde el comienzo, mostrándote lo básico y aumentando la complejidad de los niveles gradualmente, logrando una dificultad desafiante pero no imposible. Se nota bastante la dedicación detrás del juego, más aún con el curioso añadido de los comentarios de los desarrolladores. La duración es algo corta, pero no habrá ningún momento aburrido ni que se sienta repetitivo. Logra una muy buena atmósfera haciéndote sentir aislado de todo excepto de GlaDOS y sus comentarios que le añaden ese toque de humor. La banda sonora también es buenísima. En pocas palabras: juegazo.

I mean this is portal the is not too much to say.
Amazing gameplay that just "feels right".
The story is good but a lot of the story is hidden in easter eggs and such things. This isnt exactly bad, but just understand that after finishing the 2 games you might feel the urge to search for timelines and other things for this game on youtube.

Game 1 is really short, but I would still reccommend you to play it since it only costs 0.81 euro during sales i think.

Mechanics work great and the game does not have a lot of bugs that you would notice on a surface level.

The idea behind this this game is one of a kind which makes this such an amazing experience. It just feels different to everything else ive played so far.

Get it.

Do you think this is surreal? I have a strange feeling as it's not. Like the world we got today, we were imagining it 100 years ago. Could it be the same for this game? Nowadays the future is so bizarre. I love the game so much, such a relaxing puzzle solver. Even the turrets were not about trying not to die, but about trying to ''solve them''
nice portal gun you got there.

Kocham całą serię Portal, lecz wolę Portala 2, bo w Portalu 1:

- jest (moim zdaniem) za krótki gameplay (przeszedłem gre w jeden dzień)
-jest mało fabuły
-jest (nie oszukujmy się) brzydka grafika (to da się usprawiedliwić rokiem wydania gry)
-aby przejść wszystkie wyzwania na złoty medal trzeba używać gliczy typu ABH, AFH (czyli przyśpieszobego poruszania się)
-nawiązując do poprzedniego - bez gliczowania się nie da się odblokować wszystkich osiągnięć bo kilka z nich wiąże się właśnie z trybem wyzwań
-soundtrack (jeżeli tak to można nazwać) to nie muzyka tylko ambient (jest kilka nutek, ale jest ich mało) i raczej nie przepadam za tym soundtrackiem

Ale wcale nie oznacza to, że gra jest zła, bo:

-posiada gameplay, który pomimo tego, że jest krótki, zapada w pamięć na długi czas
-ma super final boss fight (mimo, że trochę za łatwy)
-W niektórych momentach wymagany jest refleks
-uciągnie ją nawet komputer z Windowsem XP zrobiony z baterii z ziemniaka
-THE CAKE IS A LIE

Рецепт Шоколадного торта:

Для коржей:
Масло сливочное несоленое (резаное кубиками) - 200 г
Мука пшеничная - 2 стакана
Сахар белый - 1 1/2 стакана
Сахар коричневый - 1/2 стакана
Какао-порошок - 3/4 стакана
Сода пищевая - 1 ч. л.
Соль - 1 ч. л.
Яйца крупные - 2 шт.
Сметана - 1/2 стакана
Ванильный экстракт - 1 ч. л.
Масло сливочное для смазывания формы

Для крема:
Шоколад черный (мелко рубленый) - 670 грамм
Масло сливочное несоленое, комнатной температуры - 300 г
